node.title: Road worker Des Carr vanished 40 years ago. An inquest hears the search may have been bungled
node.alt: A sepia-toned photograph of Desmond, wearing a tshirt, sitting on a low brick fence.
node.description: A family member of a road worker who disappeared more than 40 years ago in the Kimberley has expressed hisÂ dismay after an inquest raised the possibility the initial search was bungled.
node.content:
["A family member of a road worker who disappeared more than 40 years ago in the Kimberley has expressed his\u00a0dismay after an inquest raised the possibility the initial search was bungled.", "The baffling case\u00a0of Desmond Carr made national headlines four decades\u00a0ago and\u00a0WA's Deputy State Coroner Sarah Linton said\u00a0her open finding into his presumed death will provide no greater closure to his family.", "The inquest's findings highlighted\u00a0evidence of opportunities lost by\u00a0police, supporting the belief from family members that the initial investigation did not go far enough.", "Desmond Carr was last seen at 3pm on August 2, 1979, operating a steamroller south of Broome on the Great Northern Highway.", "An hour later a work colleague went to collect him and found the steamroller still running but Mr Carr nowhere to be seen.", "Police were notified the next day and the area's\u00a0harsh terrain was searched and no trace of the 32-year-old has\u00a0ever been found.", "But the inquest has cast doubt on the thoroughness of that search through evidence provided by one of Mr Carr's work colleagues at the time he went missing.", "
Evidence search conducted in wrong location
", "Maxwell Nairn came to police after seeing his former workmate's case featured on the Australia's Most Wanted television show in 1989.", "Mr Nairn said in his statement to police the steamroller was moved the day after Mr Carr's disappearance, meaning the search originating from the vehicle was conducted in the wrong location\u00a0by up to two kilometres.", "Mr Nairn said\u00a0police and his supervisor did not listen to his concerns at the time.", "He said he was certain of the roller's location because he drove the water truck and started work half an hour earlier than anyone else\u00a0so he could wet the road.", "", "
Desmond Carr's niece Michelle Folland and his sister Joy Hall attended a coronial inquest\u00a0hoping it would shed light on his disappearance.(ABC News: David Weber)
", "However, when the missing person's unit passed this information to Broome Police in 1989\u00a0Ms\u00a0Linton said it was not clear if it\u00a0was acted on.", "
'Search seemed brief and somewhat limited'
", "Ms\u00a0Linton elaborated further on the inadequacies of the original police investigation.", "Mr Carr's nephew\u00a0Jay Walkerden\u00a0made a podcast titled The Disappearance of Des\u00a0to try and solve the\u00a0mystery that's haunted his family.", "", "
Des Carr was suffering from headaches and had a history of blackouts at the time he went missing.(Supplied: Australian Missing Person's Register)
", "He said the evidence suggesting the initial\u00a0search was conducted in the wrong location\u00a0left a sour taste in his family's mouth.", "\"That was probably one of the biggest shocks of the inquest,\" Mr Walkerden said.", "
Coroner\u00a0does not find cause of death
", "When weighing up another witness's belief\u00a0that Mr Carr could have got lost and may have been seeking help for a week, Ms\u00a0Linton said it was more likely he would have died soon after he left the roller.", "At the time of his disappearance Mr Carr complained of persistent\u00a0headaches and had a history of blackouts.", "But Ms Linton was unable to reach any conclusion as to his cause of death.", "Mr Walkerden said even now he was still getting reports\u00a0from people who claim to have seen his uncle after his disappearance.", "The missing person's case remains open and Mr Walkerden holds hope\u00a0that in the future there may be a\u00a0breakthrough in finding Mr\u00a0Carr."]
